hero.title: For some OFWs staying in Israel, poverty is more frightening than war
hero.description: Despite what some call the worst clashes they’ve seen involving their host country Israel, just around 1% of the 30,000 OFWs are interested in going home

primary.lead: Middle East Filipinos Caught in Israel - Iran Conflict
primary.title: DFA: 127 Filipinos in Israel lost homes; 118 have been resettled
primary.description: DFA Undersecretary Eduardo de Vega told ANC that 127 Filipinos in Israel lost their homes. Of that number, 118 had already been resettled, he said.

secondary.title: No Filipino hurt during missile attack in Qatar
secondary.description: The Philippine Embassy in Qatar confirmed on Tuesday, June 24, 2025, that no Filipinos were hurt following a missile attack launched by Iran targeting American military installations there

secondary.title: Most Filipinos in Israel declining repatriation offers
secondary.description: Most Filipinos in Middle East declining repatriation offers

secondary.title: Alert Level 2 recommended in Israel; still no OFW deployment—DFA
secondary.description: An official of the Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) said that there is already a recommendation to lower the crisis alert level from 3 (voluntary repatriation) to 2 (restriction phase) in Israel

carousel.title: The Fight To Save Filipino Chocolate
carousel.description: Cacao farmers in the Philippines are using innovative solutions to fight climate change—an increasing threat to crops and livelihoods.

carousel.title: Duterte Youth’s comeuppance
carousel.description: Tempting as it might be to celebrate the decision of the Commission on Elections (Comelec) to cancel the registration of Duterte Youth as a richly deserved comeuppance for its own actions, one can’t help but feel a little skeptical.

carousel.title: The essential discord: Why education hearings are crucial, despite flaws
carousel.description: For years, the Philippine Senate and Congress have made their committee hearings publicly accessible—streamed live on television and YouTube—as a symbolic gesture of transparency.

carousel.title: 2 countries turn away Rody
carousel.description: Australia, Belgium unwilling to be ‘third country’ for ex-president. The governments of Australia and Belgium have both rejected requests to host former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte should the interim release currently being sought by his lawyers be granted
